results.description:
The First Avengers ongoing series, the one that started the Earths Mightiest Heroes campaign for justice and freedom. They will save the world, and if they can't, they will avenge it. And there came a day, a day unlike any other when Earth's mightiest heroes joined forces to face the threats no single superhero could withstand! The Avengers where born! The first volume of the Avengers lasted from 1963 right up until 1996 and ran for 402 issues. This ended during the Onslaught storyline and was continued in Avengers Volume 2.

results.description:
The Uncanny X-Men and Earth's Mightiest Heroes square off! When Magneto seeks to recover fragments of Asteorid M, the Avengers step in to investigate. Unsure of his intentions, they seek to bring him to trial before the World Court in Paris. Fortunately for Magneto, his teammates in the Uncanny X-Men step in to defend him no matter what the cost. These two teams face off and also have to deal with the Soviet Super Soldiers!

Collected in The Avengers Epic Collection: Judgment Day.

results.description:
Continued from the Avengers vol. 1. During the Onslaught Saga, many heroes were lost from the known world. They were presumed dead, but in reality, they were teleported to a pocket universe created unknowingly by Franklin Richards. As they remained here, they had no knowledge of their previous lives and their place on Earth. This volume comprises of the Avengers team's exploits during the " Heroes Reborn" story arc. After 13 issues the heroes return to their own reality and the title is continued in Avengers vol.3.

Collected in the Following Editions

  • Heroes Reborn: Avengers (#1-12)

last_issue.name: World War 3, Part 2: Winning And Losing

results.name: Avengers

results.description:
The heroes return to their own reality after their Heroes Reborn adventures in Avengers Vol.2. After issue 84 the series returns to it's original numbering to celebrate the 500th issue of the Avengers, collecting three volumes into one. On board with the 500th issue came writer Brain Michael Bendis whom would become one of the most important writers in Avengers history. The series ended after issue 503 and the special Avengers Finale one-shot and was revamped as New Avengers.

Translated into Spanish.

results.deck: The Justice League of America and the Avengers join together to defeat Krona, who has travelled to the Marvel Universe to find the truth of creation.
results.description:
The story of JLA/Avengers begins when Krona, the Maltusian who caused the original DC Universe to split into infinite realities, travels to the Marvel Universe seeking the truth of creation. There he meets The Grandmaster, who proposes they test their respective Universes against one another. Should Krona win, The Grandmaster offers to guide him to Galactus, the only being in the Marvel Universe to have witnessed the creation of existence . Should Krona's Universe lose, he is to spare the Marvel Universe from entropic destruction. Krona accepts, and the battle begins, pitting the Justice League of America (chosen to represent Grandmaster) and Avengers (representing Krona) against one another.

It is not long before the JLA and Avengers encounter one another, with the former prompted by The Grandmaster to search for twelve artifacts of power in order to save a universe, and the latter instructed by Metron of the New Gods to stop the League to prevent their world being destroyed. The hunt for the items of power begins, as various Leaguers and Avengers travel across the two universes and fight each other to retrieve the artefacts In the end, both teams meet in the Savage Land and engage in an all-out battle royale for the Cosmic Cube, which is seized by Batman, earning the JLA victory. Krona, choosing not to fulfil his end of the bargain, summons Galactus and attempts to force the knowledge he seeks out of the World-Devourer. Galactus is saved by The Grandmaster, who uses his remaining strength to merge the two universes together into a single reality.

Though seemingly stable, this new reality begins to slowly fall apart due to the original universes' incompatibility. This prompts the JLA and Avengers to join forces and avert the crisis. They are taken to a dying Grandmaster by the Phantom Stranger, and informed that Krona is trying to destroy this new reality by further merging the original two universes.

The heroes storm Krona's base, fighting numerous Marvel and DC villains in the process. The battle is eventually joined by every single hero to have ever been a member of the JLA and Avengers, allowing them to defeat Krona and restore the universe to their original singularity.

Collected Editions

  • JLA/Avengers: The Collectors' Edition
  • Avengers/JLA: Compendium
  • JLA / Avengers

Note: Indicia titles issues #1 & 3 as "JLA/Avengers" and issues #2 & 4 as "Avengers/JLA".
results.name: JLA/Avengers

results.description:
The series is a revamp of the Avengers vol. 3 and the continued volume 1 series. After the events of Avengers Disassembled, a new group of Avengers was created from the ashes. This groundbreaking series by writer Brain Michael Bendis brought the Avengers to new heights! After the conclusion of Siege in issue 64, the team reformed once more. Their adventures where continued in a concluding one-shot named New Avengers Finale and then into the ongoing Avengers (vol.4) and New Avengers Vol.2 series.

results.description:
As a result of the Initiative after the Civil War, Tony Stark forms a new team of Avengers. This government sponsored Initiative team became the primary team when the New Avengers became outlaws due to the registration act that was initiated. Although The Avengers Vol.1 title used the banner "The Mighty" Avengers for some time in the mid 1980's, it was always named "Avengers" in the indica, making this the true first title to have the name.

results.description:
The Initiative, a plan to train and police super heroes across America. Each state will have their own team. The series was launched after the Civil War crossover and started initially as a 6 issue mini-series but was upgraded to an ongoing series due to large pre-ordering numbers of the series. The series is about the students that have enrolled to the 50 States Initiative after the Superhuman Registration Act had been passed by the US Congress. The series lasted until issue 35, but was somewhat continued in Avengers Academy, with many of the teachers of this series returning.

The series had one Avengers: The Initiative Annual and two specials, namely Avengers: The Initiative Special and Avengers: The Initiative Featuring Reptil.

Collected Editions

  • Basic Training (#1-6)
  • Avengers: The Initiative: The Complete Collection Vol. 1 (#1-19 & Annual #1)
  • Killed in Action (#7-13 & Annual #1)
  • Secret Invasion (#14-19)

  • Disassembled (#20-25, Avengers: The Initiative feat. Reptil)
  • Dreams and a Nightmare (#26-31)
  • Siege (#31-35)

results.description: This is the current incarnation of Giant-Size Avengers.This is a "one-shot" and is several stories in one. The main story centers around the trio of Ms. Marvel, Wasp, and thec Black Widow. After a rather messy battle, the three heroes are at the new Avengers headquarters and as they unwind, they recount some classic stories involving the Avengers tried and true butler, Jarvis.These stories are amusing and the way in which we are constantly drawn back to our three heroines is an honest pleasure. This issue is a good stand alone read and is a wonderful comic book joy!!!

results.description: This special series of New Avengers comics is distributed free to U.S. Military personnel exclusively through AAFES stores around the world. Issues 4 though 10 are AAFES #4 #5 #6 #7 #8 #9 #10. Issues 11 and 12 continue on in Captain America: The First Avenger American Armed Forces Exclusive. Issue thirteen begins here.
results.name: The New Avengers: American Armed Forces Exclusive

results.description: Marvel Masterworks: The Avengers reprints the team's earliest adventures in hardcover format.¬† Volume One - Volume Three are second edition, 'ReMasterworks' books, which are slightly different from the Avengers books in the Marvel Masterworks volume.
results.name: Marvel Masterworks: Avengers

results.description: Reprints Avengers #57-58 and #83.
results.name: Marvel Illustrated Books: The Avengers

results.description: Reprints classic Avengers issues in Black and White. Each volume contains 20-25 issues and sometimes and annual.
results.name: Essential Avengers

results.description:
A special one-shot set between the events of Avengers Dissasembelled in Avengers Vol.3 and the New Avengers series.

Collected in New Avengers by Brian Michael Bendis: The Complete Collection Volume 1.
results.name: Avengers Finale

results.description: One-Shot for the Avengers: The Initiative series. One of the longest-running plotlines in Avengers: The Initiative is resolved at last! Hardball is among the Initiative's most respected and decorated graduates. He's become a celebrity hero in Las Vegas, with his true love, Komodo, serving nearby in Arizona. But all the while, he's secretly been in the pocket of the terrorist group Hydra! Now everything comes to a head as Komodo finds out the truth...Senator Woodman's evil plan comes to fruition...and Hardball must choose a side, once and for all! Also in this not-to-be-missed issue, Dan Slott returns to solo writing duties for the previously-untold origin of Trauma...and the shocking revelation of his link to a longtime Marvel character!
results.name: Avengers: The Initiative Special

results.description: Free Promotional Comic from Sugar Babies/Charleston Chew/Sugar Daddy Brand Candies.
results.name: The Avengers Collector's Edition

results.description: This story features an old Avengers foe, the dark sorceress¬†Morgan Le Fay ¬†. She steals the¬†Sword of Doom ¬† ¬†and remakes reality, once she has the¬†Scarlet Witch ¬†in her grasp. But Wanda Maximoff fights back, calling a dead Simon(¬†Wonder Man ¬†) back to life. Simon is not part of Morgan's reality, and that's what backfires. Her tyranny ends, with Simon too disappearing from the living¬†universe.¬†
results.name: Avengers: The Morgan Conquest
Avengers: Timeslide

results.description: A hardcover book, involving an X-Men/Avengers crossover. The original edition was a trade paperback, and released in 1995.
results.name: Avengers: Avengers/X-Men - Bloodties

results.description:
Dark Avengers Volume 1

Dark Avengers was the hit-series about a team of Avengers formed by the mind of Norman Osborn. It featured villains (most of them former team-members of the Thunderbolts) who took on the identities of famous heroes, while still staying their own evil selves. The team was backed by Norman Osborn's inelegance agency H.A.M.M.E.R.. The series was a huge hit, but only lasted for the length of the "Dark Reign" era, for a total of 16 issues and one annual. In recent issues of the second "New Avengers" series, a new team of Dark Avengers is born.

This series is also collected in trade paperbacks:

  • Assemble (#1-6)
  • Dark Avengers/Uncanny X-Men: Utopia (#7-8, Uncanny X-Men #513-514, Dark Avengers/Uncanny X-Men: Utopia , Utopia Finale)
  • Molecule Man (#9-12)
  • Dark Avengers: Siege (#13-16, Dark Avengers Annual 1)
  • Dark Avengers Hardcover (#1-6, #9-16, Annual #1)

Translated into Spanish.
results.name: Dark Avengers

results.description: Trade Paperback collecting the critically acclaimed series by Allan Heinberg and Jim Cheung.
results.name: Young Avengers

results.description:
The Secret Invasion aftermath really changed the way how heroes and villains understand the world they live in. But what could one say about marriages?

A 4-part limited series about how both Clint Barton (aka Ronin) and Mockingbird deal with the established new world order, her memories of imprisonment in the Skrull homeworld...and the rift in their relationship. Can they trust themselve enought to give their relationship a second chance? Or did the hard times change their whole live?

Collected Editions

  • Hawkeye: Avenging Archer
  • New Avengers: The Reunion

last_issue.name: The Avenger Who Came in from the Cold

results.name: New Avengers: The Reunion

results.description: One-Shot for the Avengers: The Initiative series. It feautures the debut of the hero known as Reptil.
results.name: Avengers: The Initiative Featuring Reptil

results.description: A trade paperback reprinting "Avengers" vol. 1 #167-168 and 170-177. Also contained an all-new epilogue to the storyline, intended to make the story less ambiguous.
results.name: Avengers: The Korvac Saga

results.description: What could possibly bring together the greatest animal heroes of the Marvel Universe?¬† Found out why Lockjaw has formed this team and what their quest is.¬† Written by Chris Eliopoulos and drawn by Ig Guara.
results.name: Lockjaw and the Pet Avengers

results.aliases:
Ultimate Comics Avengers
Ultimate Comics Avengers 2
Ultimate Comics Avengers 3
results.description:
The series that replaced The Ultimates 3 after the Ultimatum mini-series. The covers of the Ultimate Avengers series break this into three six issue mini-series but per the indicia and the continued numbering all 18 issues are actually one volume. The series ended with the 18th issue.

From it's 6th issue the series ran simultaneously with Ultimate Comics: New Ultimates. Both series ended in march 2011 and where replaced with a mini-series named Ultimate Avengers vs. New Ultimates.

Guess who‚Äôs back!! That‚Äôs right, kids, Mark Millar and superstar artist CARLOS PACHECO blast into the Ultimate Universe for a mind-blowing, heart-pounding and gut-wrenching event of epic proportions! When a highly-classified secret threatens Captain America, only the newly-returned Nick Fury has the tools to bring ‚Äòem in! As the first of a series of blockbuster arcs begins: Project Avengers is a go!

Collected Editions

  • Ultimate Comics Avengers: Next Generation (#1-6)
  • Ultimate Comics Avengers: Crime and Punishment (#7-12)
  • Ultimate Comics Avengers: Blade vs. the Avengers (#13-18)

last_issue.name: Blade versus the Avengers, Part Six
